description: [Status: stable] [Name: unnecessary-subscript-reversal] [Message: Unnecessary subscript reversal of iterable within {func}()] What it does Checks for unnecessary subscript reversal of iterable. Why is this bad? It's unnecessary to reverse the order of an iterable when passing it into reversed(), set() or sorted() functions as they will change the order of the elements again. Example sorted(iterable[::-1]) set(iterable[::-1]) reversed(iterable[::-1]) Use instead: sorted(iterable) set(iterable) iterable
